title: ApplicationConfigSet
description: Schema describing the set of configurations for applications running in Glue42 Desktop.

application.title: ApplicationConfig
application.description: Schema describing the configuration for an application running in Glue42 Desktop.

details.description: Detailed configuration based on the application type.

name.description: Name of the application. Should be unique.

title.description: Title used when visualizing the application.

caption.description: User friendly (longer) description that can be used by the Glue42 Desktop clients to show more detailed application information.

configMode.description: Specifies in which Glue42 Desktop configuration mode these applications will be available.

tooltip.description: Tooltip (extended description) that will be used when visualizing the application.

autoStart.description: If `true`, the application will auto start.

runPriority.description: If the `runPriority` property is missing or is zero, the application is considered to be low priority, i.e. all current applications will be low priority until someone changes/sets their `runPriority` configurations.

requiresSSO.description: This option is valid for system and auto start applications and if it is `true`, they will auto start after a successful SSO login. Note that user applications are always initialized (and this way auto started) after SSO login, so this option is useless for them.

shell.description: This option is valid for system applications and if `true`, the application will start after Glue42 Desktop initialization. Usually, this is a container based web UI application which acts as a Glue42 Desktop client.

ignoreSavedLayout.description: If `true`, the application default layout will not be auto saved when it is closed and on the next start, if the layout exists, it will be ignored.

closeOnHibernate.description: Whether to close the application when it is part of a hibernating layout.

shutdownApplicationName.description: Specify another application to be started in order to shut down the current application instances.

icon.description: URL or the Base64 encoding (only the data part from the URI scheme) of the icon used as a taskbar icon for the application.

disabled.description: If `true`, the application will be disabled.

hidden.description: If `true`, the application will not be visible in the App Manager.

allowMultiple.description: If `true`, multiple instances of the application can be started.

allowCapture.description: If `true`, this app will be allowed to capture display/window/group screenshots through the 'glue.displays' API

allowLogging.description: If `true`, this app will be allowed to log in a custom file in 'UserData/logs/application' through the 'glue.log' API

ignoreFromLayouts.description: If `true`, this app will not be saved when saving a layout, nor closed or restored when restoring a layout.

sortOrder.description: Defines the (ascending) order used by Glue42 Desktop when sending the user applications list to its clients.

saveMultipleInstances.description: When `false`, only the last application (or activity) instance will be saved in the default (startup) layout. When `true`, all instances will be saved.

service.description: If `true`, the application will not be closed when saving and restoring a layout.

customProperties.description: These name/value pairs are sent to the Glue42 Desktop clients. The Application Manager API exposes them as well, allowing custom UIs to interpret and use the values.

keywords.description: An array of keywords that can help discovering the application easier

noDelayedRestore.description: If `true`, the application will always be restored directly when restoring workspaces (no delayed or lazy restore for this app).

suspendMetrics.description: If `true`, the application won't publish any metrics.

shortcut.description: Will be registered as global shortcut and will start the app or focus it.

launcherApp.description: Name of the application to be used to launch this app.

allowRegisteringWorkspaceShortcuts.description: Will allow registering shortcuts in any workspace.

allowCookiesManipulation.description: If `true`, the app can query and modify the session cookies.

allowWorkspaceDrop.description: If `false`, the user won't be able to drop the app in a Workspace.

reuseInLayouts.description: If `true` and the app is part of a hibernated Layout, one or more of its available instances will be reused when resuming another Layout that contains the same app.

supportEmails.description: Emails of the owners of the application

urlLoadOptions.description: Describes the options for loading a window URL.

baseURLForDataURL.description: Base URL for files loaded by a data URL. Must end with a trailing path separator. This property is necessary only when the loaded URL is a data URL.

extraHeaders.description: A string with extra headers for the request. Separate the headers with a `\n`.

httpReferrer.description: URL for the `Referer` request header or a `Referrer` object specifying a URL and a policy for the `Referrer-Policy` request header.

postData.description: Data for the POST request. Either an `UploadFile` object describing the location and other properties of the file to upload, or an `UploadBase64Data` object containing data encoded as a Base64 string.

userAgent.description: A user agent originating the request.

url.description: Required. URL pointing to the location of the window application.

userAgent.description: Custom User-Agent string to use when loading URLs in this window.

isSticky.description: If `true`, the newly created window will participate in Glue42 window operations (stick, unstick, etc.).

left.description: Position (in pixels) of the top-left window corner relative to the left edge of the display.

top.description: Position (in pixels) of the top-left window corner, relative to the top edge of the display.

allowClose.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a close button.

allowTabClose.description: If `false`, the tab header will not contain a close button.

allowCollapse.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a collapse button.

allowForward.description: If `false`, the window will not contain an activity related forward button.

allowMaximize.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a maximize button.

allowMinimize.description: If `false`,the window will not contain a minimize button.

allowUnstick.description: If `false`, the window will remain stuck to other windows.

allowChannels.description: If `false`, the window will not show the channel selector.

readOnlyChannelSelector.description: If `true` аnd the Channel Selector is visible (Channels are enabled), the users won't be able to click on it and change the current Channel.

allowLockUnlock.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a lock/unlock button.

allowExtract.description: If `false`, the window will not contain an extract button.

showStickyButton.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a sticky button.

showFeedbackButton.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a feedback button.

maximizable.description: If `false`, the window will not be able to maximize via buttons and/or windows gestures.

minimizable.description: If `false`, the window will not be able to minimize via buttons and/or windows gestures.

disableTransitions.description: If `true`, disables transition animations applied when showing a hidden window or changing its state during minimize/restore/maximize.

autoSnap.description: If `true`, when the move operation ends, the window will snap to one of the approaching edges of another window (if any of the approaching edges are marked with red).

autoAlign.description: When `true`, a snapped window will adjust its bounds in order to have equal width/height and/or to occupy the space between other windows (if any).

icon.description: URL or the Base64 encoding (only the data part from the URI scheme) of the icon used as a taskbar icon for the window. If not specified, it will use the icon from the application configuration.

borderColor.description: Can be a color name, such as "red", or a hex-encoded RGB or ARGB value.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the Electron window. Can be a 6 or a 3 digit hex value (#7FA or #1e1e1e).

collapseHeight.description: Defines the height of the window when collapsed.

devToolsEnable.description: If `true`, allows opening a developer console (using `F12`) for the new window.

isCollapsed.description: If `true`, the window will start collapsed.

isPopup.description: Deprecated, use `isChild` instead. If `true`, the window will open as a pop-up, sharing the lifetime and environment of the opener.

isChild.description: If `true`, the window will be created as a child window of the application/window creating it. This means that it will share the lifetime and environment of the opener.

focus.description: If `false`, the window will not take focus when created.

hasMoveAreas.description: If `false`, a window in HTML mode can not be moved.

hasSizeAreas.description: If `false`, a window cannot be resized by dragging its borders, maximizing, etc.

hidden.description: If `true`, the window will start as a hidden window.

historyNavigationEnabled.description: If `true`, will allow users to navigate back (`CTRL+Left`) and forward (`CTRL+Right`) through the web page history.

injectionIntegration.description: Deprecated - use allowExtensions - Whether to allow а web application hosted in Glue42 Desktop to be accessible by external scripts injected in the window

mode.description: Glue42 window type. Possible values are `flat`, `html`, `tab`.

serviceWindow.description: A legacy setting which indicates whether the app should be hidden (also provides other relevant settings). Currently not used.

moveAreaThickness.description: How much of the outer window area is to be considered as a moving area (meaning you can move the window using it). The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom borders.

moveAreaLeftMargin.description: The Glue42 window can contain a move area thickness left margin. The margin is related to the left border of `moveAreaThickness` only. The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom.

moveAreaTopMargin.description: The Glue42 window can contain a move area thickness top margin. The margin is related to the top border of `moveAreaThickness` only. The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom.

moveAreaRightMargin.description: The Glue42 window can contain a move area thickness right margin. The margin is related to the right border of `moveAreaThickness` only. The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom.

moveAreaBottomMargin.description: The Glue42 window can contain a move area thickness bottom margin. The margin is related to the bottom border of `moveAreaThickness` only. The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom.

moveAreaPassThroughMouseHover.description: If `true`, mouse hover events which are over move area will be passed to the underlying Electron window.

onTop.description: If `true`, the window will appear on top of the Z-order.

relativeTo.description: The window ID of the window that will be used to relatively position the new window. Can be combined with `relativeDirection`.

relativeDirection.description: Direction (`bottom`, `top`, `left`, `right`) for positioning the window relatively to the `relativeTo` window. Considered only if `relativeTo` is supplied.

showInTaskbar.description: If `false`, the window will not appear in the taskbar.

showTitleBar.description: Whether the window will have a window title bar.

sizeAreaThickness.description: How much of the outer window area is to be considered as a sizing area (meaning you can resize the window using it). The string value corresponds to the left, top, right and bottom borders.

sizeAreaPassThroughMouseHover.description: If `true`, mouse hover events which are over size area will be passed to the underlying Electron window.

snappingEdges.description: Specifies the active Glue42 window snapping edges. Possible combinations are: `top`, `left`, `right`, `bottom`, `all` and any combination of them (e.g. `left, right`).

stuck.description: Identifies whether an application has to be stuck to particular location

sizeMode.description: Defines the window width or height in pixels or percents of the containing monitor

display.description: The identifying number of the monitor (e.g., 1, 2, 3 or "main")

frameColor.description: Specifies the Glue42 window frame color. Accepts hex color as a string (e.g., `#666666`) or named HTML colors (e.g., `red`)

stickyFrameColor.description: Specifies the color that indicates on which side the windows will stick.

stickyGroup.description: If set, the Glue42 window can only stick to windows that belong to the same group.

tabGroupId.description: Specifies the tab group ID. If two or more tab windows are defined with the same ID, they will be hosted in the same tab window.

tabIndex.description: Specifies the tab position index. Tab windows in the same tab group are ordered by their position index. Use negative index to make the tab active.

tabSelected.description: Whether the application tab to be on focus when the app is opened as a tab window in a tab group.

hideGroupHeader.description: Hides the group header when a window joins this windows group

title.description: Sets the window title. To work properly, there should be a title HTML tag in the page.

type.description: The loader animation type. Check the "Loader Animations" for possible options.

background.description: Changes the background of the loader page. Accepts hex color as a string (e.g., `#666666`) or named HTML colors (e.g., `red`).

speed.description: Changes the animation speed. A bigger number means faster animation.

size.description: Use this to set an absolute size to the loader animation in pixels. Note that not all loader types support that setting.

sizeFactor.description: Use this to set the size of the loader animation as a factor of the window size.

hideOnLoad.description: Use this to hide the loader once the page is loaded.

text.description: Use this to display text on the loading page.

textSize.description: Use this to set loader text font size.

textColor.description: Use this to set loader text color. Accepts hex color as a string (e.g., `#666666`) or named HTML colors (e.g., `red`).

useRandomFrameColor.description: If `true`, will set a random (from a predefined list of colors) frame color to the new window.

windowState.description: If set, the window will start in the specified state (maximized, minimized, normal).

autoInjectAPI.description: Specifies if the Glue42 JavaScript API will be auto injected in the window context. The `Glue()` factory function becomes available without referencing a `desktop.js` file.

enabled.description: If `true`, will enable auto injection of the Glue42 JavaScript library.

autoInit.description: If set, will auto initialize the injected Glue42 JavaScript library.

oneOf.description: Whether to enable auto initialization of the Glue42 JavaScript library.
Initialization options you can specify if you want to auto initialize the injected Glue42 JavaScript library.

autoInjectFdc3.description: Specifies if the glue-fdc3 JavaScript API will be auto injected in the window context. The api becomes available without referencing any JS file.

enabled.description: If `true`, will enable auto injection of the glue-fdc3 JavaScript library.

oneOf.description: Whether to enable auto initialization of the glue-fdc3 JavaScript library.
Initialization options you can specify if you want to auto initialize the injected glue-fdc3 JavaScript library.

context.description: Custom context object associated with the window.

autoOpenDevTools.description: If set, DevTools will start automatically.

sfMode.description: Set to `true` to run the window in Salesforce mode (resolving the issues preventing Salesforce to run in a desktop container).

registerHtmlContainer.description: Whether to inject the `htmlContainer` object. This is used for legacy applications.

contextMenuEnabled.description: When set to `true`, will enable the native browser context menu.

contextMenuMode.description: Supported values: `native` and `custom`. If `native`, then the native menu will be shown. Otherwise, an Interop method will be invoked with context menu and spell check info.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time (ms) that a refresh handler will have to complete its operation.
The maximum amount of time (ms) that a close handler will have to complete its operation.

injectSIDtoContext.description: Whether to inject the SID in the window context after successful SSO authentication.

visibleAreas.description: Which parts of the opened window to be visible. The window itself will not be resized. The parts of the window outside the specified areas will remain intact but will be invisible.

allowExtensions.description: If `true`, this app can host chrome extensions. Extensions must be enabled in system config.

syncTitleWithDocumentTitle.description: If `true`, window title will change when the document title is updated

nativeWindowOpen.description: If `true`, calling `window.open` from JavaScript code will open the URL in the default browser. The default option is to open in a new container window.

pagePerformanceMetric.description: Enabling this will allow this application to publish performance metrics extracted from the underlying Chromium browser.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the Page Performance metric for this application.

publishInterval.description: The interval (in ms) in which page performance data will be published

initialPublishTimeout.description: The time (in ms) after which the initial data will be published

placement.description: Specifies the window position relative to the screen

snapped.description: If `true`, the Glue42 Window will remain snapped to the specified screen position even in cases of resolution changes, window visibility changes or when the application virtualization window hosting the Glue42 Window has been resized. However, this doesn't include any API calls or manual user interaction which affect the window placement or bounds. If `false`, the window will be positioned at the specified screen location only once when created

verticalAlignment.description: Defines a vertical alignment configuration. If `horizontalAlignment` is set, then `verticalAlignment` will default to "stretch"

horizontalAlignment.description: Defines a horizontal alignment configuration. If `verticalAlignment` is set, then `horizontalAlignment` will default to "stretch"

margin.description: Sets the margin for all four sides of the window

oneOf.description: Use a `number` to define the width in pixels
Use a `string` to define the width in pixels or percentage of the screen width - e.g., "10px" or "10%"
Use a `number` to define the height in pixels.
Use a `string` to define the height in pixels or percentage of the screen height - e.g., "10px" or "10%"

display.description: The identifying number of the monitor (e.g., 1, 2, 3 or "main")

buttonsVisibility.description: Determines the conditions under which the window buttons will be visible. Valid only for Glue42 Windows in `html` mode.

disableRefreshOnF5.description: If `true`, the user cannot refresh the window.

allowPin.description: If `true`, will allow pinning shell applications to the taskbar.

appId.description: Specify a unique application ID necessary for selecting the correct icon for the pinned application in the taskbar. Defaults to `appName-env-region`.

displayName.description: The name that will be shown on right click on the application pinned to the taskbar. Defaults to configured build name or `Glue42 Enterprise`.

command.description: Specify the command (and all arguments needed) for relaunching the application. Defaults to the current Glue42 Enterprise executable with its starting arguments.

commandEnvVar.description: Specify the environment variable used for storing the command (and all arguments needed) for application relaunch. Defaults to `GLUE_START_CMD` and is ignored if `command` is set.

iconPath.description: Specify the path to the icon that will be used for the pinned to the taskbar application. Defaults to the application icon or the default one. It is strongly recommended to explicitly specify an icon here and to use an icon persisted on the machine.

iconIndex.description: Index of the icon specified in `iconPath`. Ignored when `iconPath` is not set. Defaults to 0.

combineIcons.description: Determines how the taskbar icons of the app instances will be combined with each other and with icons of other Glue42 apps when the Windows taskbar is set to combine icons. Can be `sameIcon`, `sameApp` or `never`. Set to `sameIcon` to combine the icons of the app instances with each other and with all other Glue42 apps that use the same icon. Set to `sameApp` to combine the icons only of the app instances. Set to `never` to prevent the icons of the app instances from combining with each other or with other Glue42 apps that use the same icon. Defaults to `sameIcon`.

allowOSInfo.description: If `true`, the app can retrieve OS information.

allowClearingCache.description: If `true`, the application can clear session and host cache.

preloadScripts.description: A list of preload scripts (URLs) that will be loaded and executed before the actual page is executed

allowCookiesManipulation.description: If `true`, the app can query and modify the session cookies.

activity.title: activityConfig
activity.description: Defines an activity as a set of activity window types. Also defines the other activity related parameters (like layout and initial context).

initialContext.description: Initial activity context in a JSON format (not parsed for now and used as is).

hideGroupHeader.description: If `true`, there will be no header for any window groups that are in the activity window.

autoSaveContext.description: Activity context can be saved as part of a saved layout. The activity owner window can register a callback to describe the members of the context that should be saved. If no handler is registered, then by default no activity context will be saved. By using this option and setting its value to `true`, the user has an option to save activity context for legacy applications (i.e., these that haven't registered such callbacks).

saveOwnerOnly.description: When an activity application is saved, by default only the activity owner window information will be stored. This will "work out of the box" for legacy activities that don’t support saving/restoring layouts and contexts. When this is `false`, all activity windows (or the ones configured using the options below) will be saved.

includeTypesToLayout.description: Comma separated list of window types which should be included in the activity application auto saved layout.

ignoreTypesFromLayout.description: Comma separated list of window types which should be excluded from the activity application auto saved layout. Note that `ignoreTypesFromLayout` has priority, i.e. if a window type is defined in both lists, it will be excluded. Also, if `includeTypesToLayout` is specified but not `ignoreTypesFromLayout`, then the types in the `includeTypesToLayout` list will be included in the layout and the rest will be excluded and vice versa.

exe.title: EXEConfig
exe.description: Executable application. Could be anything that the OS can execute via the appropriate system calls.

showConsole.description: If `true`, the console will be visible.

useShellExecute.description: If `true`, `path` is not used (and must be empty) and the specified command can contain a well known resource type (like URL) which will be executed via the "shell execute" option, i.e. using the associated application.

path.description: This is the working directory of the target application/script and could either be relative to the Glue42 Desktop startup directory, or an absolute path. The path must exist and will be combined with the command parameter, if it doesn’t contain a root drive. Required, if `shellExecute` is false, otherwise must be empty.

command.description: This is the target application/script that will be executed (when `useShellExecute=false`) or a resource that will be opened via an associated application if `useShellExecute=true`. When `useShellExecute=false`, a command target file must exist. It could contain relative (to the Glue42 Desktop startup folder) or an absolute file path.

parameters.description: Optional parameters that will be used when starting the target application/script or opening the resource. The content is used as is, no checks performed.

windowStyle.description: Specifies the target's main window style (if supported).

trackingType.description: Specifies how to track the lifetime of the target application process , i.e. to determine when it is started and stopped.

agmTrackingLaunchTimeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for AGM tracked instance to connect. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

startingContextMode.description: Specifies how to pass application starting context to the client application.

passGlueToken.description: This option is valid for external user applications and if it is `true`, when they are started a valid GW3 token will be sent.

glueTokenArgument.description: The name of the token argument.

top.description: Position (in pixels) of the top window border, relative to the top edge of the display.

tabGroupId.description: Specifies the tab group ID. If two or more tab windows are defined with same ID, they will be hosted in the same tab window.

relativeDirection.description: Direction (`bottom`, `top`, `left`, `right`) of positioning the window relatively to the `relativeTo` window. Considered only if `relativeTo` is supplied.

tabIndex.description: Specifies the tab position index. Tab windows in the same tab group are ordered by their position index. Use negative index to make the tab active.

relativeTo.description: The window ID of the window that will be used to relatively position the new window. Can be combined with `relativeDirection`

relativeDirection.description: Direction (`bottom`, `top`, `left`, `right`) of positioning the window relatively to the `relativeTo` window. Considered only if `relativeTo` is supplied.

allowClose.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a close button.

allowTabClose.description: If `false`, the tab header will not contain a close button.

allowCollapse.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a collapse button.

allowMaximize.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a maximize button.

allowMinimize.description: If `false`,the window will not contain a minimize button.

allowExtract.description: If `false`, the window will not contain an extract button.

showStickyButton.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a sticky button.

showFeedbackButton.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a feedback button.

allowUnstick.description: If `false`, the window will remain stuck to other windows.

allowChannels.description: If `false`, the window will not show the channel selector.

readOnlyChannelSelector.description: If `true` and the Channel Selector is visible (Channels are enabled), the users won't be able to click on it and change the current Channel.

allowLockUnlock.description: If `false`, the window will not contain a lock/unlock button.

maximizable.description: If `false`, the window will not be able to maximize via buttons and/or windows gestures.

minimizable.description: If `false`, the window will not be able to minimize via buttons and/or windows gestures.

disableTransitions.description: If `true`, disables transition animations which are applied when showing a hidden window, minimize, restore, maximize, etc.

showInTaskbar.description: If `false`, the window will not appear in the taskbar.

isSticky.description: If `true`, the newly created window will participate in Glue42 window operations (stick, unstick, etc.).

logging.description: If `true`, the `stdout` and `stderr` will be saved in the log folder under the `application` folder with the name of the application.

startFailedMessage.description: Error message that should be displayed to users if the `citrix` application fails to start.

trackingType.description: Specifies how to track the lifetime of the target application process , i.e. to determine when it is started and stopped.

agmTrackingLaunchTimeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for AGM tracked instance to connect. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

startingContextMode.description: Specifies how to pass application starting context to the client application.

dontReplaceLocalhost.description: By default the list of command-line arguments will be processed to replace localhost and 127.0.0.1 addresses with the machine's network IP. Set this argument to true to suppress this behavior.

terminateOnShutdown.description: Whether to terminate the application when Glue42 Enterprise shuts down.

showConsole.description: If `true`, the console of the Node.js script will be visible.

path.description: This is the path to the JavaScript file to be executed in `Node.js`.

url.description: This is the URL to the JavaScript file to be executed in `Node.js`.

headers.description: Set of headers that will be added to the request for downloading the script file.

noCache.description: If `true`, the `Cache-control: no-cache` header will be added.

passGlueToken.description: If `true`, when the app is started, a valid GW3 token will be set as an environment variable - `gwToken`.

oneOf.description: Enable debugging on the default port 9229.

inspect.description: Enable the inspector agent. If `boolean`, listens on the default address and port (127.0.0.1:9229). If `number`, listens on the port number.

oneOf.description: Enable debugging on the default port 9229.

inspectBrk.description: Enable the inspector agent and break before the user code starts. If `boolean`, listens on the default address and port (127.0.0.1:9229). If `number`, listens on the port number.

oneOf.description: Enable debugging on the default port 9229.

activityWindow.title: activityWindow
activityWindow.description: A window which takes part in an activity and may or may not be the owner.

left.description: Position (in pixels) of the left window border, relative to the left edge of the display.

top.description: Position (in pixels) of the top window border, relative to the top edge of the display.

activityLayout.title: activityLayout
activityLayout.description: Specifies the `mode` and `cellSize` of the layout.

mode.description: Whether the activity window dimensions are in absolute (pixels) or relative (percents) tp the screen.

cellSize.description: Size modifier for each activity cell in the activity grid.

cellWidth.description: Size modifier for the width of each activity cell in the activity grid.

cellHeight.description: Size modifier for the height of each activity cell in the activity grid.

screen.description: Can specify the target screen by index or "main" to indicate the primary display device.

activityTarget.title: activityTarget
activityTarget.description: Specifies how this application will be registered as an activity window.

enabled.description: Whether to register the application as an activity window.

windowType.description: Specifies the activity window type that will be associated with this application, i.e. when there is a request from the activity manager to create this type, an application instance is started. Defaults to the application name.

isIndependent.description: Deprecated. Whether this activity window type can act as an independent window, i.e. to belong to any activity.

left.description: Position (in pixels) of the left window border, relative to the left edge of the display.

top.description: Position (in pixels) of the top window border, relative to the top edge of the display.

windowState.description: If set, the window will start in the specified state (maximized, minimized, normal)

default.description: If true the application will act as default workspace application (will be used if no workspace app is specified or the specified one is missing).

left.description: Position (in pixels) of the left window border, relative to the left edge of the display.

top.description: Position (in pixels) of the top window border, relative to the top edge of the display.

windowState.description: If set, the window will start in the specified state (maximized, minimized, normal)

updateFrameConstraints.description: When enabled GD applies the min max constraints to the Workspaces Frame window

layouts.description: Workspaces to be loaded when a new frame is loaded

framePool.description: Controls the count of cached frames, which will be used for workspace extract. The higher the number the higher the consumed memory, the lower the number the chance for workspace extract rejection, because the pool is empty will be higher.

allowOSInfo.description: If `true`, the app can retrieve OS information.

syncTitleWithDocumentTitle.description: If `true`, tab title will change when the document title is updated

restrictWindowDropByOrigin.description: If `true` only applications opened in the workspace will be allowed to be dropped inside of it and all other apps won't be

allowWorkspaceTabExtract.description: If `false`, the user won't be able to extract any of the Workspace tabs in the Workspaces App. This will override the Workspaces API locking configuration.

minWidth.description: Specifies the minimum width in pixels for the Workspaces App.

minHeight.description: Specifies the minimum height in pixels for the Workspaces App.

maxWidth.description: Specifies the maximum width in pixels for the Workspaces App.

maxHeight.description: Specifies the maximum height in pixels for the Workspaces App.

workspaceLoadingAnimation.description: Configuration for the Workspace loading animation.

enabled.description: If `true`, will enable showing a loading animation while a Workspace is being loaded.

hideOnLoad.description: If `true` (default), will hide the Workspace loader once all visible windows in the Workspace have been loaded.

autoInjectAPI.description: Specifies if the Glue42 JavaScript API will be auto injected in the window context. The `Glue()` factory function becomes available without referencing a `desktop.js` file.

enabled.description: If `true`, will enable auto injection of the Glue42 JavaScript library.

webGroup.title: webGroupConfig
webGroup.description: Configuration for the Web Group App used in Glue42 Enterprise for web-based Glue42 Window groups.

url.description: URL pointing to the location of the Web Group App.

preloadScripts.description: A list of URLs pointing to scripts that will be loaded and executed before loading the Web Group App.

autoOpenDevTools.description: If `true`, the Chrome Dev Tools for the web group page will start automatically. Suitable for debugging purposes, in case your web group page contains an error and can't start properly.

timeout.description: In seconds to load the page.

retryCount.description: Incremental intervals. The application waits a short time before the first retry, and then incrementally increasing time between each subsequent retry. For example, it may retry the operation after 1*500, 2*500, 3*500, and so on.

webGroupPoolConfig.title: webGroupPoolConfig
webGroupPoolConfig.description: Configuration for the pool of cached Web Group App instances that will be used for various operations - open, extract, unstick, etc.

min.description: The minimum number of cached Web Group App instances. The higher the number, the more memory will be consumed; the lower the number, the higher the chance to experience delay during web group operations.

applicationProcessAffinity.description: Deprecated. Defines configuration for application process affinity config

affinity.description: Deprecated. Set this to override the default grouping logic configured in system.json. If set will group the app only with apps with the same affinity.

dedicatedProcess.description: Deprecated. If true will keep the app in separate process.

displayName.description: Display name used to visualize the intent

contexts.description: The type of predefined data structures with which the app can work

resultType.description: Metadata describing the return type of the callback which handles the intent

loadingConfig.description: Configuration for the loading of applications when opening Workspaces.

loadingStrategy.description: Default loading strategy when opening Workspaces.

initialOffsetInterval.description: Valid only in `delayed` mode. Initial period after which to start loading applications in batches.

interval.description: Valid only in `delayed` mode. Interval in minutes at which to load the application batches.

batch.description: Valid only in `delayed` mode. Number of applications in a batch to be loaded at each interval.

showDelayedIndicator.description: Visual indicator `Zzz` on tabs of apps which are not loaded yet. Useful for developing and testing purposes.

referrer.description: Describes the values that will be used for the `Referer` and the `Referrer-Policy` request headers.

policy.description: Value for the `Referrer-Policy` request header. For more details, see the [`Referrer-Policy` request header documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Referrer-Policy).

filePath.description: Path to the file to upload.

length.description: Number of bytes to read starting from the value set in `offset`.

modificationTime.description: The time the file was last modified expressed as a number of seconds since the UNIX epoch.

offset.description: Position of the first byte to read.

type.description: Type of the uploaded data. Must be set to `file`.

uploadBase64Data.description: Describes data to upload encoded as a Base64 string.

data.description: The data to upload encoded as a Base64 string.

type.description: Type of the uploaded data. Must be set to `base64`.
